name: y
description: 1. move into a directory you would like keep the final project files (IE: mkdir cs132-final; cd cs132-final) 2. clone the project to your computer using the link provided at the clone button    `git clone https://github.com/<username>/beam-cs132.git` ## making edits to the project and saving them You can edit the files in the directory there and push your changes to github, but here is a quick example of what that may look like.  1. Make edits to a new file (here were adding hi to the hi.txt file)   `touch hi.txt; echo "hi" > hi.txt` 2. Add files with changes to repo   `git add -A` to add all files    `git add hi.txt` for just that file 3. Commit changes and don't forget to include a note!    `git commit -m <message>`   `git commit -m "Added new file">` 4. Push to github (to finally add everything   `git push`
